summary: The "Harnessing Effective and Appropriate Long-Term Health for Moms On Medicaid Act of 2025" (HEALTH for MOM Act of 2025) amends Title XIX of the Social Security Act to allow states the option to provide coordinated care through a maternity health home model for pregnant and postpartum women enrolled in Medicaid. This includes care coordination, patient-centered care plans, and the integration of various support services. It outlines payment structures, data collection requirements, and confidentiality protections. Planning grants are also included to assist states in developing state plan amendments.
